Copy.Pstm48:
Wow - another year has gone by!

Your little one is four already - that was quick! We hope you and your child enjoy the birthday celebrations.

If your child's a bit of a chatterbox, you may find yourself switching off from time to time, rather than focussing on everything that comes out of their mouth. But listening to your little one is important - it boosts their confidence, helps them learn new language skills and strengthens the bond between you. Read our guide to what to expect from your four year old's development over the next six months.

Also this month, if you're finding it tough to make ends meet, we've got advice on how to boost your finances.
Copy.Pstm49:
Every so often, we like to remind you to keep your first aid knowledge up to date, just in case. So here's a refresher on family first aid. Plus, how to perform CPR.

We've also got some top tips for creative fun with your little one. Arts and crafts can be done with lots of items lying around the house so affordable and will keep kids entertained for hours.
Copy.Pstm50:
More and more dads are the stay at home parents now as mum goes out to work. They work in the same way as a stay at home mum, doing the school run, making the dinner and dealing with the homework.

Also this month, we've got ideas for family activities on a budget. Keeping a little one entertained doesn't need to be expensive and there are loads of things to do which are cheap or even free.
Copy.Pstm51:
If you'd like to turn your back on the daily grind, you're not alone. But going it alone can seem like a massive risk and it's hard to take the first step. If you'd like to start things off by making a bit of extra cash working from home, we explore your options here.

Also this month, we look at the importance of reading with your little one. It is a powerful learning resource for children and will help improve their language and literacy skills. Play is also important for your little one as they learn and develop through playing with others as well as playing by themselves.
Copy.Pstm52:
Sadly, relationship breakdowns are a fact of life - and however strained things might get, it's important that children carry on enjoying a healthy relationship with both parents. We've got some advice on how to make a success of single parenting and ways to adjust if this has affected you.

On a more cheery note, your little one might be starting to read a few words now. If so, don't cut back on reading together now they can do it on their own. The time the two of you spend looking at books can bring their reading skills on in leaps and bounds.
Copy.Pstm53:
Having a fabulous wardrobe doesn't have to cost the earth. It's easy to mix and match, updating your look with accessories as you go, so you always look effortlessly amazing. Building a good capsule wardrobe will also save you time in the mornings. No more fussing about what to wear - you'll have a range of practical but glamorous outfits at your fingertips.

Also this month, check out our delicious home made ice cream recipe.
Copy.Pstm54:
If your little angel is more a little devil from time to time, you're not alone. We offer some guidance on discipline to help you stay firm and get a healthy balance. Don't forget, communication is key and will help with your child's behaviour - so you might want to give yourself a reminder of our advice on listening to your child and getting them to listen to you.

Plus, if you are looking for some ideas for a break away with a difference, we have some unusual ones that will be great fun for the whole family.
Copy.Pstm55:
We'd all like more cash - and if you read our money pages, you might find you can hold on to a bit more of yours! We've got advice on surviving on less money and how to make your finances go further.

Also this month, we've got information on staycations for a holiday close to home that is still full of all the fun and excitement as going abroad.

It's been a few months since we last covered some basic first aid. So it's a good idea to take a look at our guide for a quick reminder.
Copy.Pstm56:
This month we've put together a guide on dealing with bullying. It's not nice to think about but many children are bullied at some point during their school days. Make sure you know the signs - and what to do if it happens to your child.

If you've got more than one child, the chances are your little darlings don't get on all the time. They might be best friends one minute and at each other's throats the next. So if tensions are running high and you need a bit more help, we've got advice on dealing with rivalry.
Copy.Pstm57:
If you fancy going off in search of some sun, read our guide to planning a family holiday before you take to the skies. There are some fab family-friendly places out there and lots of them won't break the bank. While you're at it, check out our travel survival kit to make sure you have everything you need to treat any minor ailments while away.

We've also got tips on flying with young children to make your trip as stress free as possible from the word go.
Copy.Pstm58:
Children love camping - and it's a wallet-friendly holiday option. So if you fancy a few nights with nature, read our advice on camping with kids and learn how to cope with life under canvas.

Fresh air is great for your child, and it'll wear them out and help them sleep well at night! Read our guide to the best outdoor adventures to find out what you can do to make the most of dry and sunny days.

Also this month, we've got information on step parents and how to get a new relationship off to a good start.
Copy.Pstm59:
Kids love cooking - and you can have lots of fun together making scrummy treats like cakes, puddings and simple meals. We've got a delicious recipe for home made ice cream you could try.

We've also got some fun games for the whole family to try which will be great for bonding.

Finally this month, don't let your kids wear you down - read our advice on resisting pester power.

TRENDING_TITLE.Slot2: What no one tells you about the first 12 weeks of pregnancy 1404
